agentic_rag.tools package

rag_tool module

class agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.Settings(persist_dir: 'str' = 'faiss_index_azure', chunk_size: 'int' = 700, chunk_overlap: 'int' = 150, search_type: 'str' = 'mmr', k: 'int' = 4, fetch_k: 'int' = 20, mmr_lambda: 'float' = 0.3, api_key_env: 'str' = 'AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY', api_version_env: 'str' = 'AZURE_OPENAI_API_VERSION', endpoint_env: 'str' = 'AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT', chat_deployment_env: 'str' = 'AZURE_OPENAI_CHAT_DEPLOYMENT', embed_deployment_env: 'str' = 'AZURE_OPENAI_EMBED_DEPLOYMENT')[source]

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.get_azure_embeddings(settings)[source]

Create an Azure OpenAI Embeddings client from environment configuration.

Parameters:

settings (Settings) – Runtime configuration holding the environment variable names and defaults.

Returns:

Configured embeddings client for computing vector representations.

Return type:

AzureOpenAIEmbeddings

Raises:

RuntimeError – If any of the required Azure OpenAI environment variables are missing.

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.get_azure_chat_llm(settings)[source]

Instantiate an Azure Chat LLM client with deterministic generation settings.

Parameters:

settings (Settings) – Runtime configuration holding the environment variable names and defaults.

Returns:

Configured chat LLM client used for answer generation and evaluation.

Return type:

AzureChatOpenAI

Raises:

RuntimeError – If any of the required Azure OpenAI environment variables are missing.

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.load_documents_from_dir(path)[source]

Load supported documents from a directory recursively.

Supported extensions are .pdf, .txt, .md, and optionally .docx.

Parameters:

path (str or pathlib.Path) – Root directory to scan for documents.

Returns:

Loaded documents with basic metadata such as source.

Return type:

list of langchain.schema.Document

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the directory does not exist.

  • RuntimeError – If no supported documents are found in the directory.

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.split_documents(docs, settings)[source]

Split documents into overlapping chunks for retrieval.

Parameters:

  • docs (list of langchain.schema.Document) – Source documents to be chunked.

  • settings (Settings) – Chunking configuration (size and overlap).

Returns:

Chunked documents preserving metadata.

Return type:

list of langchain.schema.Document

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.build_faiss_vectorstore(chunks, embeddings, persist_dir)[source]

Build and persist a FAISS vector store from document chunks.

Parameters:

  • chunks (list of langchain.schema.Document) – Pre-split document chunks to index.

  • embeddings (AzureOpenAIEmbeddings) – Embeddings client used to embed the chunks.

  • persist_dir (str) – Directory where the FAISS index and metadata will be saved.

Returns:

The constructed FAISS vector store instance.

Return type:

FAISS

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.load_or_build_vectorstore(settings, embeddings, docs)[source]

Load an existing FAISS vector store or build a new one.

Parameters:

  • settings (Settings) – Configuration including the persist directory path.

  • embeddings (AzureOpenAIEmbeddings) – Embeddings client used to embed chunks.

  • docs (list of langchain.schema.Document) – Raw documents to split and index if no persisted index exists.

Returns:

Loaded or newly built vector store.

Return type:

FAISS

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.make_retriever(vector_store, settings)[source]

Create a retriever with optional MMR and log retrieved chunks.

Parameters:

  • vector_store (FAISS) – The vector store to retrieve from.

  • settings (Settings) – Retrieval configuration, such as search_type and k.

Returns:

A retriever-like object exposing invoke and get_relevant_documents methods that also prints a preview of retrieved chunks.

Return type:

object

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.retrieve_chunks(question, retriever, max_chars=500)[source]

Retrieve top chunks for a query and return a compact, structured view.

Parameters:

  • question (str) – The user query used to retrieve relevant chunks.

  • retriever (object) – Retriever exposing an invoke method returning a list of Documents.

  • max_chars (int, optional) – Maximum number of characters to include from each chunk, by default 500.

Returns:

A list of records with chunk_id, source and truncated content.

Return type:

list of dict

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.format_docs_for_prompt(docs)[source]

Format documents into a plain-text context block for prompting.

Parameters:

docs (list of langchain.schema.Document) – Documents to concatenate with [source:...] tags.

Returns:

A single string containing all documents with source annotations.

Return type:

str

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.build_rag_chain(llm, retriever)[source]

Create a LangChain pipeline that retrieves context and generates answers.

Parameters:

  • llm (AzureChatOpenAI) – Chat LLM used for generation.

  • retriever (object) – Retriever exposing an invoke method for fetching contextual documents.

Returns:

A runnable chain that accepts a question string and returns a string answer.

Return type:

Any

agentic_rag.tools.rag_tool.rag_answer(question, chain)[source]

Run the RAG chain on a question and return the answer text.

Parameters:

  • question (str) – The input question to answer.

  • chain (Any) – Runnable chain created by build_rag_chain().

Returns:

The generated answer.

Return type:

str
